children.value: version 0.2.0! This is the first update after the initial release of the alpha üê£client. As you might expect, it contains a lot of bug fixes and updates. We highlight some of the most significant ones below:
‚å® Tab-autocomplete and dropdown in the CLI

You can now press Tab to autocomplete a command when you start typing it in the command-line interface. In addition, dropdown menus display the available options as users select exchanges and trading pairs.
You don't have to run your own node anymore!
now supports cloud-based Ethereum node services such as Infura. Please see this
for the complete list of supported node services.
We have created a pre-compiled version of
from Docker that contains all dependencies, which allows you to run hummingbot using a single line command. Docker images of
are available on Docker Hub at
for more on how to install and run
üóÉ Separate global and strategy-specific configuration files
In the future, we expect that users will run multiple strategies, including those that they create and customize. To accommodate this use case, we separated configuration settings into:
settings that are used for all strategies, such as exchange API keys, wallets, and log/configuration file locations. By default, these are located in the
: settings such as exchanges, trading pairs, spread, and trade size that are applicable to a specific strategy. These are located in the
automatically sets trade sizes by default, some users have asked for the ability to override this setting manually. The strategy-specific settings now contain a
is denominated in the quote asset. To get the corresponding size for the base asset, divide by the price. For example, if the trading pair is ZRX-WETH, the current mid-price is 0.002, and
parameter is 1.00, then the trade sizes are 1 ETH for bid orders and 500 ZRX for ask orders.
Based on alpha user feedback, we realized that only saving logs when
exits may prevent logs from being saved in case of a crash. Now, log messages are saved to the log file in real-time to persist in the event of a crash.
Fixed bugs that prevented automatic cancellations of orders upon exiting
Fixed a bug with the Binance co-routine scheduler died and prevented Binance API calls from going through
Improved error handling of invalid responses to command prompts
Increased test coverage for the cross-exchange market making strategy
Added an initialization message after the
Last but certainly not least, a big
to the alpha testers who went the extra mile to help improve
by submitting bugs and feature requests:
